content.description:
This is very similar to

Little Robots in Your Pants

except with two thoughtful cruxes instead of one.
content.location:
This is the left hand route on the east-facing wall just uphill and at right angles to the wall containing

Night School

.

content.description: This has good climbing up nice rock on a less-than-vertical wall. It might only be 5.7 for taller folks, it sometimes gets dirty from runoff above.
content.location: Follow the trail under the obvious roof cracks to the right side of the formation. From the belay ledge, this is the first climb on the left.

content.description: It's an OK climb, but it is still fun. This can be a little dirty.
content.protection: Eight bolts and anchors at the top.
content.location:
It is on the right side of

Night School

.

content.description:
A nice pitch on good rock which seems pretty easy until you hit a puzzling crux near the end. The rock at the bottom is granite, but partway through appears to become crosley dotted limestone -- is this just a patina or an actual layer change?

This section of cliff seems to collect a lot of runoff debris.
content.location:
The right hand route on the east facing wall just uphill and at right angles to the wall containing

Night School

.

content.description: After clipping the first bolt most folks move left to mantle onto the ledge. From here, follow tricky climbing out the overlap, then up the face to the final rattly fingers crack. One of the best 5.10's at the Narrows. Anchor may have old slings that need replacing.
content.protection: Bolts and gear from .4 to .75 camalots.
content.location: On the left side of the Watchtower, this is the uppermost route in the gully.

content.description: Starts on the face past a bolt. The second bolt is under the roof. Make the move around the corner. Climb the arete about 20 feet then make your way right to the chains. Really fun moves throughout.
content.location: The farthest route right in The Watchtower.
